intro: Helladia, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flower heads, which resemble small crowns, hence its common name. Helladia species typically have narrow, grass-like leaves and produce small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. These plants are often used in ornamental gardening due to their unique appearance and drought tolerance.
